seller_description: Brand Aquasonic Age Range (Description) Adult Special Feature Waterproof, Ergonomic, Lightweight, Travel Size, Brushing Timer Power Source Battery Powered Item Firmness Description Soft. About this item: 40,000 VPM Smart Toothbrush Beauty, brains and power. The Black Series is a world class modern electric toothbrush packed with the most up to date technology. It features an ultra-powerful and industry leading motor producing 40,000 vibrations per minute, a lithium-ion battery, ultra-fast wireless charging, 4 mode operation, smart vibration timers, 8 DuPont engineered brush heads, and a custom travel case; all with a sleek ultra-slim, lightweight and IPX7 rated waterproof design. Accepted by the American Dental Association (ADA) Council on Scientific Affairs We put our money where your mouth is. Investing in premium oral care technologies has earned the Black Series the prestigious ADA seal of approval. It has shown efficacy in removing plaque and helping to prevent and reduce gingivitis. Black Series goes beyond just cleaning teeth it provides complete oral care with unique modes that include one for whitening and polishing teeth, and one for improving gum health. Modern Tech for a Healthy Smile - Black Series brings toothbrushes into modern times with its built-in enhanced features. A lithium-ion battery, ultra-fast wireless charging (forget outdated USB charging), 4 distinct brushing modes and a smart vibrating notification timer are some of the enhanced features built into the sleek and ergonomic waterproof black satin handle. 8 DuPont Brush Heads   Travel Case Included Included are 8 brush heads engineered by world famous DuPont; a world leader in quality   materials science. Each brush head lasts 3-4 months so 8 will last for about 2.5 years. Also included is a convenient custom hard shell travel case made of BPA-free plastic with space for two brush heads. Black Series can last 4 full weeks (2 min/2x a day) on a full charge so it's perfect for on the go travel with the included travel case. What's in the Box - 1 AquaSonic Black Series Smart Toothbrush, 1 wireless charging base, 8 DuPont brush heads, 1 travel case, warranty card, and user manual.
review: The third time that I used this toothbrush, I thought that I'd broken off a tooth. But no, it was a large chunk of the brush head. It literally disintegrated.. Trying to remove the bristles from my mouth was not fun. I was using the brush properly on the lowest speed. Do not purchase this product. It could actually be dangerous of some of the plastic pieces are swallowed.
expected-output: Seller's Description: The seller's images and description emphasize the advanced features of the AquaSonic Black Series toothbrush, including its powerful 40,000 VPM motor, long-lasting battery life, and durable build. The toothbrush is marketed with 8 DuPont brush heads designed for extended use over 2+ years, providing value for long-term care. The brand highlights the ADA seal of approval, four brushing modes (cleaning, soft, whitening, massage), and an ergonomic design. Additionally, a sturdy travel case with space for two brush heads is presented, suggesting portability and durability. Buyer’s Experience: The buyer’s experience significantly diverges from the seller’s claims. In their review, the buyer mentions that while initially enthusiastic about the toothbrush, they experienced critical durability issues very early in its use. Specifically, during only the third use, a large part of the brush head disintegrated, raising concerns not only about the product’s quality but also its potential safety risks. The buyer describes an alarming moment where they initially mistook the broken brush head for a tooth fragment. Moreover, retrieving the scattered bristles from their mouth was reportedly difficult and unpleasant. Discrepancies: Durability: The seller’s claim of durable DuPont brush heads is contradicted by the buyer’s experience of the brush head breaking after minimal use. This discrepancy points to possible quality control issues with the brush heads or a mismatch between the product’s advertised strength and actual durability. Safety: The seller promotes the product as safe, even with ADA approval; however, the buyer’s review raises safety concerns, especially if users risk swallowing detached plastic or bristle pieces. This represents a potential health hazard that the seller’s materials do not address. Usage Expectations: The buyer states they used the toothbrush correctly on the lowest speed, which implies that the product should have functioned safely without such an incident. This issue could indicate a defect in the product’s construction rather than user error. Conclusion: The buyer expresses clear dissatisfaction due to the toothbrush's failure and potential safety risk, which contradicts the seller's emphasis on durability and quality. This situation suggests the seller may need to reassess the quality and construction of the brush heads, particularly if this feedback is consistent among other users. While the product is marketed as high-quality and durable, the buyer’s experience reflects a significant quality gap, making it difficult to endorse the product as safe and reliable.
label: 0:Here seller is at fault
